parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn away, pervert, remove; I restore, replace; mid: I desert, reject. From apo and strepho; to turn away or back.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural

str2: Probably from pheugo; fugitive; Phygellus, an apostate Christian.
Hermogenes, a man of Rome. From Hermes and ginomai; born of Hermes; Hermogenes, an apostate Christian.
